txt.en: 'I see Shemûl's desperate eyes whenever I close my own.'
'I wish I could have saved her. I wish more than anything she was still here with me.'
'I wish fortune had taken me instead.'
Speak with Jínsa in Amalíbi's camp
Listen to Mizâdi and Amalíbi's conversation
Let Mizâdi know you have helped the wounded
'As the first wave crashed into us, I flipped the first man over my shield, stabbing him before he could regain his footing.'
'But there were so many. As the second and third wave crashed into us, we moved back, and back further. There were so many.'
Speak with Mizâdi in Amalíbi's camp
'Shemûl was in her element. She bore two short swords and no shield, as it let her do twice the fighting and none of the hiding, as she said.'
'She took down six or seven Ordâkhai in quick succession, going low in one slice, then high a moment later.'
Give the bottle of Khôrob for Gúrumkir
'She was a whirling storm of blades, moving almost too quickly to be seen.'
'Then it happened, with me leaning against a rock wall, just trying to survive.'
Listen to Mizâdi and Amalíbi's conversation.
'I heard a pop and a crunch beside me. At first I thought my leg had been broken, but no.'
'The crunch was Shemûl's leg breaking, the pop her sinews snapping.'
Speak with several of the wounded soldiers in Amalíbi's camp and ask if they require aid.
'An Ordâkhai Umûn stood over her, having delivered an axe strike through her leg.'
'I quickly stabbed him through the chest and he fell back, dead.'

'There's no telling what we may find here. I believe they bring the sacrifices upstairs to one of their dark altars. That is likely where we'll find Numûru and any other unfortunates they've gathered.'
Defeat Karâshna Zíri
Enter Amalíbi's encampment near Iridír
Give the fresh bandages to Zagêli
Listen to Mizâdi and Amalíbi's conversation
Speak with Zagêli in Amalíbi's camp

'Oho, you've come to help us, have you? Aid us in our time of need? Well I have great need of you then, friend. Great need.

'The Umûn says I can't have any Khôrob. I know, it is a tragedy. Usually I'd just swipe it as soon as her back was turned, but with this bum leg, it makes any petty thievery a terrible bother. She thinks it makes for bad soldiers. I say it makes for the best soldiers. Or at least the happiest.

'What do you say? Can you make a bottle of Khôrob appear in these old hands?'
Speak with Gúrumkir in Amalíbi's camp

'You're helping those in the camp? That is very nice of you. I don't need much, I have a warm bedroll and enough bread to get by.\n\n'Maybe I could tell you my story? These words in my head seem to weigh heavily on me, pressing me down. Unless you don't want to hear it?'
'Please, I should just be Mizâdi to you.'
'I came here to apologize for my words in the hall.'
Listen to Mizâdi and Amalíbi's conversation.
'We also came to aid you where we can.'
Let Mizâdi know you have helped the wounded.
'Thank you, [placeholder]. Amalíbi and I have much to discuss.'
'Thank you for hearing my story, friend. It helps.'
'I am sorry for what I said. I do not believe it.'
'I was just stung because of how much truth I heard in your words. I was a fool.'
Speak with Mizâdi in Amalíbi's camp.
'This - all this - is my fault.'

'I meant what I said. I will see these people restored to their homes. I will see them made whole.'

Mizâdi pauses, and her breath becomes hushed.

'I swear it.'
'My shoulders are broad.'
'I will see these people restored to their homes. I will see them made whole.'
'There is no happy outcome here. But thank you for listening to my story.'
'It helps to tell someone.'
'Maybe I won't see her eyes pleading with my own tonight.'
'We should return to Iridír, for there is much to plan.'

'Ah, it's good of you to ask. It's not much, but these bandages have frayed, and they are more dirt than cloth at the moment.\n\n'Would you see if there are any fresh ones among the quartermaster's things? Nothing worse for the spirit than soggy dressings.'
Ask to hear Jínsa's story
Listen to Jínsa's story
Comfort Jínsa in Amalíbi's encampment
A small moment of peace has given Mizâdi time to speak with Amalíbi, to see the consequences of her decisions.
Speak with Numûru in the Angar Aragín.
Go with Razâl up the tower stairs to find Numûru.
Free Numûru from his bonds.
This crate is filled with fresh cloth, wraps, and bandages
You've found an unattended, mostly full bottle of Khôrob
Go with Razâl up the tower stairs to find Numûru
Defeat All-seeing cultists ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Speak with Razâl in the Angar Aragín.
Ascend the stairs to find the other prisoners.
Defeat the Barkhûshim within the Angar Aragín.
Comfort Jínsa in Amalíbi's encampment.
Help Amalíbi's wounded with their various needs.
Defeated Barkhûshim ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Give the fresh bandages to Zagêli and the Khôrob to Gúrumkir in Amalíbi's camp.
Gather fresh bandages for Zagêli
Find a bottle of Khôrob for Gúrumkir
Instance: A Glimpse of Daylight
Listen to Jínsa's story
'But we will punish those with whom the fault actually lies.'
'No one's shoulders are that broad. And there are many hands here to help you, don't forget that.'
'I never doubted it.'
'Thank you, both of you, for coming.'
Enter Amalíbi's encampment near Iridír.
'My greetings to you, Shâra.'
'Very well. Friend, could you see to the needs of our wounded?'
'There are several warriors in the camp that I'm sure would benefit from your aid.'
'You are not a fool. You are just young, and impassioned.'
'I know something about that myself.'
'But watch that fire. It is not only your enemies that can be burned by it.'
'Thank you. I can dress the wound myself. It's the little things that make the days a bit more manageable, don't you think?'
'It is not, and you know that.'
'I... I know that.'
'You - you are not the only leader who blames herself.'
'They overtook us as we were marching west of Ghalbûru. We heard them by the crunch of their boots before we saw them.'
'Hundreds of boots pounding the soil. It was then that fear seized my heart. I knew no force in the Khûd moved in such numbers.'
'My good friend Shemûl saw my face, and punched my arm, saying 'steel yourself! Now we will see some real fighting.''
'We recognized them as Ordâkhai, but flying under a new banner, a silver lion.'
'Amalíbi told us to ready ourselves for battle.'
'We found what defensive positions we could, but we were caught out of Ghalbûru, out in the open.'
'At thirty paces, the enemy stopped. The silence was somehow worse. No birds chirped. It was as if nature herself held her breath.'
'Then the Ordâkhai let out screams as one and charged us.'
'I clutched my shield tight to my shoulder, that it may not move, and readied my sword arm.'
Free Numûru from his bonds
Speak with Numûru in the Angar Aragín
Speak with Razâl
Ascend the stairs to find the other prisoners
Free the first prisoner
Free the second prisoner
Free the third prisoner
Defeat the Barkhûshim ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Free the prisoners.
Defeat the Barkhûshim!

'Oho, you really did it! Yes, that's the stuff. Don't worry, the Khôrob belongs to all of us in the company, there's no actual thievery. I'd say you've done a great job here. This soldier will be very happy for the rest of the afternoon.'
Defeated All-seeing cultists ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'It is nice of you to ask. Very well, I will tell you of the attack that caused all this.'
'I pulled Shemûl to me, pleading for her to be all right.'
Speak with Razâl inside the Angar Aragín
'I saw a look of desperation in her eyes, as though she was trying to escape her failing body.'
'Then, she was gone. Just gone. No more my dear friend than a sack of potatoes.'
TBD
'I let out a scream, then I ran into the fray.'
'I must have been knocked out, for I woke up some hours later in the dark surrounded by the dead, many of them my friends.'
'He is wounded. I will get him out of Kûr Anzar, leave it to me. Free those poor souls above us, they need your aid most now.'
'I staggered out, returned to Ghalbûru and then we moved here, to Iridír.'
'I can no longer sleep, friend.'
